subject: Nutrition
title: Health Halo Effect
description: A short lesson to help you apply Health Halo Effect.

hook.text: People eat 35% more at restaurants they see as healthyâ€”the label turns off their calorie awareness.

buildup.text: The health halo makes people assume everything from a 'healthy' brand is low-calorie and nutritious.

discovery.text: Subway customers estimated meals had 35% fewer calories than the sandwiches actually contained.

twist.text: Organic cookies have the same calories as regular ones, but people guess they have 40% fewer.

climax.text: Health halo marketing lets junk food hide behind branding without changing a single ingredient.

punchline.text: Healthy branding can make junk food invisible.

quiz.question: How much did Subway customers underestimate their calories?
